SENT.plain: Giant aneurysms involving or adjacent to the circle of Willis exhibit three CT patterns: nonthrombotic, partially thrombotic, and completely thrombotic
Partially thrombotic aneurysms have the most specific pattern, consisting of a "target" configuration on the post-contrast scan
Ring calcification of the wall or mural thrombus is frequently observed in partially or completely thrombotic aneurysms
Calcification is not seen in nonthrombotic lesions
Angiographic and neuropathological findings are correlated with the CT findings
